title: Quick & Fine
body: I have used CHEC for a number of years for my regular check ups and found my appointments to be quick and fine, always run as expected. I attended at Woodside Medical Practice

title: Great practice
body: My experience was great and helpful to understand. The practitioner was very good in explaining the issues. The follow up phone with the prescription was also very good.

title: A compassionate, efficient Doctors' Practice
body: I've been registered with this practice for many years. I have only been met with helpfulness and efficiency from the Reception Team. The nurses are awesome, kind and caring. I can only praise the GPs who have always made time for me be it a mental health issue or a physical one and they have been so supportive when my son has had health issues this year. Thank you for all the hardwork you do.

title: A compassionate, efficient Doctors' Practice
body: I've been registered with this practice for many years. I have only been met with helpfulness and efficiency from the Reception Team. The nurses are awesome, kind and caring. I can only praise the GPs who have always made time for me be it a mental health issue or a physical one and they have been so supportive when my son has had health issues this year. Thank you for all the hardwork you do.

title: Great practice
body: I've been attending Rosemary's GP practice for over a year and I've never experienced such a good care from any doctor before. They always have time to listen to your concerns, are very quick at referring to specialists and I never have to wait long for an appointment. The practice itself is very well run by friendly and attentive team. Thank you for looking after me.

title: Great Service
body:
I would like to begin by giving a special thank you to the midwife who looked after me from when I arrived at the hospital and until I gave birth. She was  professional, calm, reassuring ,friendly and a great asset to the NHS and hospital midwifery team. I would also like to give a special thank you to the  trainee midwifes who assisted , they also were very supportive and helped me tremendously. They will be great midwives in the future . 
The midwife team overall was outstanding and very hard working. Everyone working in the department was polite, friendly, reassuring and professional. I required an assisted delivery and would also like to give a special thank you to the surgical team, the nurses and all the members of staff who assisted . Their professionalism was outstanding.

readBy.name: West Hertfordshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Fantastic service
body:
I needed an endioschop and was very nervous. I was treated with dignity and
Professionally in a relaxed friendly atmosphere everything explained. Why i was nervous is beyond me.
Fantastic service Thankyou NHS

title: Excellent Receptionist and Doctor Service
body: I booked an emergency appointment for my child in the morning. The receptionist was kind and respectful. The doctor was also kind and professional. I appreciate the services of the staff there. Great response and feedback and it was undertaken in a swift manner so thank you!

title: Great service
body: Thank you to the nurse who called me back this afternoon to allay my concerns following major surgery last week. With clear, calm knowledge of information helped reassure me before the weekend was upon us. I came away having felt listened to and felt she understood the reason for my concerns. Thanks also to the admin member who had to listen to be attempt to describe my symtoms/concerns and dealt with the call patiently and efficiently. Always receive "Great Service" from this practice. Hope you all get a well-deserved break over the Christmas period and come back refreshed in the New Year.

title: The best practice in Bath
body: I recently made an appointment at Widcombe surgery because I felt very lethargic and my blood pressure was high, and the service I got was wonderful! The doctor who saw to me didn’t have any space left available and only worked a few days a week in the Surgery but she kindly saw me right at the end of her shift. Not only was she empathetic and kind, she was extremely helpful at explaining my blood results and helped me understand that I have Hypothyroidism. As someone who suffers with Anxiety she answered all of my questions without hesitation, she didn’t hide anything from me but she somehow made the experience less scary and definitely put my mind at ease. Not only did I feel like I got one hundred percent of her time and attention, she quickly got me the medication I required and made sure I left the Sugery happy with an understanding of what would come next. I came to write a review about the doctor but I can’t miss out the rest of the staff who were lovely too. The receptionist greeted me with a huge smile like she was happy to see me and the nurses who I have seen in the past have always been kind. I will be recommending Widcombe Surgery to anyone who asks!! Lovely atmosphere, kind and happy staff and very helpful…they help make the NHS look great!

title: Great surgery
body:
I just want to say a massive thank you and understanding at Nuffield house
I’ve never had a problem with this surgery
Even throughout Covid I was always able to either get a telephone appointment or if needed they would call me in if it was a matter to be seen face 2 face , their doors were never locked
I’ve recently used the surgery for myself and can’t not thank them enough
And also another lady on reception that really put her self out to help my sick daughter who is suffering from strep at the moment even the pharmacist at the stow
People please be kind they are doing a job
And with rudeness it doesn’t get you any where
Yes nhs is struggling , but how do you know the staff aren’t
Be kind and understanding they are human too

title: Excellent  Support  from Surgery
body:
I needed a same day appointment. After discussing  symptoms with Receptionist she got me the last one available to see Nurse Practitioner. I had walked down to surgery on off chance for advice. Despite them being very short staffed due to illness ( yes they are human) I was impressed  by the care I was given by Reception. The Nurse Practitioner saw me later that day and after examining me, taking history I was prescribed medication. I was so appreciative - and have a chance of feeling well for Christmas  now. I am on track for follow up if things don't improve. The  Pharmacy work v.hard in a small space- and obtained my medication for me. I have always found this Surgery to be there for me when I need medical help. I understand my part in the process though, and use their online system to order drugs ( in good time to recieve them ) manage symptoms myself ( before requesting  an appointment) and if it was necessary - go to A&E or a walk in centre. Their  online website information  gives good medical advice on simple ailments and what to do in an Emergency.  I feel as a Patient it is my responsibility to understand how the NHS can help me and what is my part in the process. I have witnessed awful behaviour in waiting room from patients towards Receptionists when their demands are unrealistic.
Staff are doing their job and triage requests appropriately. Well done Ley Hill Surgery and Pharmacy  despite difficult  times. Thank You

title: Good Service
body: Due to an emergency was asked by the practice to move my appointment to a special Saturday morning surgery. Was very impressed with the commitment of the doctor with coming in on a weekend and helping me with my systems.

title: Very welcoming and all staff very friendly.
body: From the reception to the discharge nurse all the staff were full of smiles and explained everything.

title: Patient centred and compassionate
body:
I just wanted to leave a review about the fantastic service we recently experienced. My husband brought our son in to see the GP, due to anxiety and associated nausea. The GP was fantastic. He was reassuring and compassionate and explained to our son why anxiety causes the feelings of nausea. He also signposted us to further help for anxiety in older children.  When I asked my son how he felt after seeing the GP his answer was “listened to” and “safe”. 
Thank you

title: Excellent care
body: Needed an appointment urgently and receive one same day. The GP listened to my concerns and took them seriously. She asked my opinion about a treatment plan and we also planned for weekend if my condition worsened. I was very impressed.

title: Friendly and helpful
body: Having to get my name changed on the system quickly for a covid pass for travel to America, both the receptionist and medical administrator were very helpful, did their best to resolve the issue and gave me assurances that they would continue to help! All sorted and my thanks to them!

title: Very pleasant receptionists and nurses
body: The services given are perfectly fine but the requirement to telephone the surgery at 8 a.m. is an absolute pain!  In my experience is - you make the call at a second after 8 only to find you are 39 in the queue!  There has got to be a better way and what does it cost to be hanging on for 30 minutes or more?

title: Terrible!!!
body: This practice is awful.  Even if you are the first person to call the practice, there are *never* any appointments for you ever and always tell you to call the next day fist thing in the morning and once you do no appointments available again.  Absolutely useless. I don’t understand why it’s there.

title: Personal ?
body: Sat near reception I was astounded to see a member of staff push in front of the queue and knock an elderly man 2 steps to the side. Having waited 1hour 15 mins over the appointment time I asked at reception only to have the above member of staff very put out at having to explain , that was made very obvious. Belligerent and unhelpful ! I found this really sad that one person clouded the experience at the clinic . The rest of the staff were pleasant , polite and very helpful.

readBy.name: East Lancashire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Terrible appointments service
body: They've been running this calling at 8am system to get an appointment several years now, and its dire. It's not only impossible to get an appointment with your own doctor but stressful and frustrating. Even if you call at the time they say, you get user busy for ages, then get stuck in a queue (which only has capacity for 15 people). When you get through after at 45 mins on hold all the appointments are gone. I feel sorry for the elderly or those who cant call at this time, who it must be so difficult for. I've been at this surgery all my life and having to call at a specific time on the day along side the rest of the town is just ludicrous. You should be able to make appointments in advance at any time and they should be allocated according to seriousness and vulnerability. Most of the Dr's work part time / only 2 days a week. Should not be allowed. They also don't have up to date correct pharmacy opening times. Instead of all hanging out in the back room chatting, why doesn't someone ring round and update things.

title: Very unprofessional practice
body:
Some time ago I was often coming to this surgery as I felt constant dizziness, pain in all body, etc. No one ever cared about my complaints. They never offered me to do any tests, even didn’t bother to call me about my tests results (tests I asked myself). Eventually I became very depressed because of the pain I feel every day. But GP only told me: you probably have all these pains because of anxiety or depression. I was feeling so hopeless in this surgery so I would never recommend it to anyone!!!!!! My last visit with them was when I came to my GP office, politely asked her to do some tests as I don't want to live anymore and she didn't even care what I said. She was just looking at me like I would be a tree. After this consultation I was thinking about death because I was totally alone in all this pain, no doctor wanted to help me here.
Thank God I changed surgery and the doctors finally did some tests and gave me an answer - I have Lyme disease!!! Unfortunately, it was 3d stage (neuroborreliosis) already. Now I am feeling much better after the long treatment although some things were already seriously damaged (balance, joints). These “doctors” could have stopped it in the beginning if they would just have listened me and did some tests.

Although there was a one amazing receptionist. She was so caring and lovely. I am really thankful for her!

title: Dreadful
body: Crawley Down Health Centre was a pretty decent practice until taken over by Modality. Impossible to get an appointment by phone so visited the surgery.  No appointments available this year, not yet making appointments in January.  Before Modality Partnership it was possible to book online, now the Health Centre website has disappeared to be replaced by a difficult to use Modality Partnership site.  Still, as the stated aim in Modality is to use less qualified medical staff and aim at 80% non face to face appointments is it any wonder? Absolutely awful, the National Health Service heirarchy that approved this merger should hang their heads in shame. The only way to get same day treatise to go to Accident and Emergency.

title: Absolute discrace
body: 2 minute wait turned into 2 hour then 5 minute wait turned into 4 hours, then was told needed a scan which will be done in 5 minutes 1 hour later got scan, 7 hours on and waited for results 2 hours, you are just fobbed off all of the time and can't get to know anything, it's just one lie after another(is that part of the qualifications), will not be going back I'd rather suffer

title: Something needs to change
body:
The medical staff are phonemonal. 

However, similar to other commenters, the receptionists and trying to get an appointment are not positive experiences.

It is impossible to get an appointment on the day .  With an unwell child you are faced with no other option but to go to a walk in (yesterday the wait was 5 hours . The majority of people waiting clearly had been unable to get GP appointments . So increased demand for Gps is clearly a problem across the country).

 Your other option is to see a private GP, which yes we felt we had to do faced with an unwell child, the looming weekend and feeling in dispair with no where else adequate to go to in reality. 

I understand that there is a clear national shortage of GPs, that Fairbrook has employed other medical staff to help and that there is a lack of GP surgeries in Borehamwood proportionally to the ongoing increase in Borehamwoods population.

But we are living in the 21st century. Being unble to see a Gp when poorly is really not good enough regardless of whatever the reasons behind these barriers are. There is no justification.  Something needs to be done and quickly.  

Will we be faced with the only option to go privately?

title: Absolutely disgusting
body: My daughter had been admitted into a&e the previous night and 111 told me a referral had been sent to the hospital. Get there and there’s no referral. Next night we have to call again as my daughter is vomiting a lot of fresh blood. Told a doctor will call us right away. That was 1am. I am writing this at 9am with no call from anyone. My 5 year old is vomiting blood and no one thinks that’s a call worth making no? No wonder everyone goes to a&e with their health problems, because getting to see or speak to anyone else is near impossible, absolutely disgusting.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: If you ring for an appointment, you have to call at 8am & end up in a long queue of callers. If you are not "lucky" enough to get through, you have to try again the following day or ring 111, no exceptions. Appalling service.

title: Busy but professional
body: The department was busy at 0820 when I arrived but my wait was only 90 minutes before I was taken to the Surgery assessment room. I have the utmost respect for the staff who were obviously busy and stressed but provided a friendly and professional experience.

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely Superb
body: Visited in November and diagnosed with bppv. Doctor superb and very understanding. Had to contact again December speaking to another Doctor in the Practice and again very understanding, service brilliant

readBy.name: NHS Leeds ICB

title: The worse experience of my life
body: Hospitals are suppose to be a place where care takes place. This hospital lacked in so many aspects. I arrived struggling to breathe to the point where I was coughing non stop when the nurses were doing my vital checks, I was also struggling to speak.  I arrived at 22:30pm on 09-10-22. Many people were pushed in-front of me, whilst I understand some cases may be severe but a handful of individuals who went before me (even though I had arrived hours before them) had conditions and symptoms that were less severe than mine. I waited over 12 hours and was seen the next day at 11:00am. Over 12 hours to be seen. I have a family of doctors and can really sympathise but the way this hospital in particular is running with the increased amount of A&E patients is terrible. There needs to be a system in place to support each patient without having to make them wait A day to be seen. The doctors need to have a more clear list to follow and should have a rule of only pushing individuals at the back of the waiting list with only one person being placed in front and not multiple. I unfortunately lost count of how many were pushed in-front of me. Secondly, the Nmc of conduct states compassion and empathy, the majority of the staff in this hospital had shown 0 remorse for what was unfolding in front of them. And when anyone tried to approach the staff, that to politely, they kept ignoring and running into their private rooms. Very unprofessional. A review  of the hospital really needs to be put in place as I am shocked at what I witnessed today. I am shocked at the standards of practice.

readBy.name: Barts Health NHS Trust

title: Impeccable service from the start
body:
Yes I work at the hospital so some would say I am biased but I could quite easily not have left a review. But I feel it’s important to give good feedback when it’s earned. Too many negatives these days and I know how hard these guys work. The receptionist was amazing at changing an appointment for me to accommodate me and my circumstances. Lovely, friendly and very kind. 
I arrived for my first appointment just to have what I thought would be a routine eye test. But how wrong was I. My tests and consultation all sorted within less than 90 mins I had several eye checks, scans, spoke to the nurses and then the consultant, had a pre assessment done and was ready for my op in a couple of weeks time. Amazing service.  Quick, thorough and friendly. Everyone made me feel welcome and put me at ease. My consultant explained everything. Was informative, knowledgeable, reassuring and just super lovely. She made sure I knew exactly what to expect. 
The nurses were fabulous and had a great sense of humour which helps when you’re feeling nervous. They put me at ease. Didn’t rush me and listened to what I was saying. 
Overall I would recommend everyone having eye issues to be referred to outpatients 10. Their service is impeccable! Thank you.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exemplary care
body:
I would like to pass on my sincere thanks to the nurses that looked after me at Accident & Emergency on both Saturday and Monday morning in early December. After accidentally burning myself in the kitchen, I was a bit shaken up but felt very reassured and well-cared for once arriving at Accident & Emergency. Despite it being busy on the Saturday morning, I was seen pretty quickly (and had the same experience again early on Monday morning).

The nurse I saw on Saturday morning was understanding and compassionate: they talked me through all of the various steps/ actions they were taken, including a potential referral to another hospital unit. They were kind and understanding, despite the potentially embarrassing nature of the incident.

After the advice to return again after 48 hours, I was seen by a different nurse, but one who was equally caring and empathetic. Although the wound was healing well at this point, there was further reassurance and the opportunity to return in another 48 hours if required.

You could tell that the staff were working incredibly hard and we see in the media that A&E units are very busy, so I didn't really want to go after the accident. However, the care I received was exemplary and I am so grateful for the nurses that looked after me.

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: good doctors and nurses bad receptionists
body: i have recently had to visit salters meadow a few times and had a few phone calls. having to deal with the receptionist is a real test of patients . being spoken down to and being dismissed is what you come to expect. on the last occasion i was waiting for a nurse to phone which did not happen and then received a text saying i had not turned up for my appointment. also i cannot understand why the receptionist want to know why i need to see a doctor and want me to tell them my ailment in front of people in a queue .

title: Very happy
body: Filled in online form at 7.44am and the message said a Nurse would review and aim to call me within an hour. Forty minutes later a doctor called me and asked lots of questions and issued a prescription straight to a local chemist. He asked if could access my medical records which was fine. I'm happy with the response and treatment.

title: They don't care about you
body:
I phoned for an appointment as i'm unwell.
Was told i would have to wait over 4 weeks
 was asked personal questions by receptionist and phone was put down on me abruptly.
I can't see how this kind of behaviour is tolerated by the NHS

title: Car park
body: Had a disabled badge yet the car park was full of people waiting for people visiting as they didn’t want to pay! When I finally begged someone to give up the space and went to the car parking booth told no staff on nothing I can do! Well does that mean you can park where you like and he said yes! What kind of service are you running for the disabled people who visit !!!! Discussing on all levels

readBy.name: Gastroenterology Department, Queen's Medical Centre

title: great practive
body: I was rushed to this hospital from dartford after heart attact. I was taken straight to unit to have a stent put in which they completed and saved my life along with the ambulance crew.  I has taken up to the ward in cardiac care unit and stayed for 3 days, and looked after very well by nurses and doctors. Thank you. I hope not to be seen again but if anything happens again I know i be looked after.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing service and staff.
body:
We went here following 111 giving us an appointment. They were so friendly. They were very thorough and reassuring towards my mum. She knew something wasn’t right and they reassured her that her feelings were correct. She had an instant referral to the right place and was made to feel very welcome and looked after. 

We cannot thank you enough.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: A wonderful team
body:
I cant recommend this practice highly enough. 
From the reception staff & nurses that have helped and given me treatment recently I cant thank you enough .
You are doing a great job.

title: Excellent care
body: My husband and I have always received excellent care from this practice and feel very fortunate to have them as our GP. All of the  staff doctors nurses and reception have been very kind thorough and helpful. Thank you all .

title: Just superb!
body: I went for a colonoscopy today at Royal Oldham.  Never been ill or spent anytime in hospital so didn't know what to expect.   The whole process was seamless.  The staff, from reception, nurses and the Consultant were so friendly and caring and explained the whole procedure and updates throughout.  I opted for gas and air and watched on camera everything going on.   Quite amazing seeing inside my body.   And it wasn't painful.  Thank you for looking after me so well and showing such compassion and care.   5 stars!

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Exceptional Medical Centre
body: Absolutely brilliant service. Treated me with care and respect. Dealt with my problem without fuss. I was seen on the day I telephoned and referred to the hospital within hours. Will always be thankful for this Medical Centre.

title: Attentive and polite
body:
I'm happy they have given me good service,  although I've only been there a few 3 weeks now.
I am quite new to the practice and already being asked to submit a review,  I wouldn't have too much knowledge/ experience at this gp but the receptionist are very helpful

title: Pharmacy outstanding
body:
The person in the pharmacy organised delivery of medication for Covid and went above and beyond to make sure I received it.  I can’t tell you how much that meant to me and wanted to thank them to show my gratitude.  That gratitude is also extended to the person who delivered it as well.
I wouldn’t have been able to get it in the bad weather and their efforts show how much we should appreciate the NHS and all the people who work hard in it.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care for my procedure
body: I had a. ICD implant rocedure and the team on the 3rd floor that see you in and the guys in the operating theatre to the guys on the 6th floor were  great and made me feel very comfortable and confident I would love to name them all but not allowe …. Just want to say a big thank you to all and our amazing NHS how lucky we are !!

readBy.name: Barts Health NHS Trust

title: Awful pain and no support
body: I have been on the phone since 10am. Its now 12 14pm. I have hurt my hip and struggling to walk. I have 3 kids 12 and under so cannot take them to A&E as they may pick up another infection. Don't wish to call 999 as there are others that maybe in a life threatening situation. I don't know what to do. My pain is awful. Whilst sitting or standing. Nobody is answering my call and I am extremely upset. Don't know what to do. Very dissatisfied

title: Dreadful waste of time
body: 1 hour on hold to speak to a rude woman, asking unrelated questions, trying to lead me to Covid, which isn’t what my daughter has. I had phoned whilst she was asleep, so she made me wake her up even though this bore no relevance to any of her further nonsense questions. After all that she rattled through the pre-written script and told me someone would call me back… still waiting

title: Poor Administration
body:
My son had severe throat infection. Tried calling the gp to get an appointment for 2 days. I was exactly on the phone sharp at 8:00 o clock and was on the line for 15- 20 minutes. When the call was picked up I was told that they don’t have any more appointments. This happened on the second day as well. After having an argument with the receptionist I was told that they are short of gps and if you really want an appointment come to the surgery in the next day morning. This is  absolutely ridiculous. Why I wasn’t advised to come to the surgery when I called them on the first day? If the surgery doesn’t have the capacity to provide services, they should limit their patients. We are living in a developed country where a patient had to wait for 3 days to be seen by a doctor? 

Secondly , I was only given a telephone appointment and was told that the GP will call you by 6:30 pm . How a child can be checked by over telephone ? I was put on panic until the GP calling me. Why this practice couldn’t have an organised appointment system like other practices? This GP practice is not readily available to serve the patients.

title: Excellent care and service
body:
My wife was admitted to CDU on 08/09 December 2022
All staff were very attentive and hardworking, some struggling with their own health.

I cannot praise everyone enough from the ambulance crew through to all the staff including house keeping. Please know I appreciate all you do. 
May you have a blessed and peaceful Christmas.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Disrespectful Service
body: Took my daughter there today as she was suffering from a cough and congested nose. That just wouldn't leave her alone, she is a toddler. Yet when she goes to see the triage nurse get told she looks fine to her and then tells me to sit in the corridor for the doctor. No mention of how long this will take and basically looking at me as if I wad a liar. My partner went to ask how long the doctor wait would be. Same nurse she said is it you or the other one waiting with your child as you both cannot wait. She then continued ohh it maybe a 2 hour wait at least!!!! So first of all you were rude then rude again and then think its ok for a toddler to wait there for over 2 hours for a doctor. Yeah ok thank you for your unhelpful service. When did the NHS get so rude.

title: Appalling service
body: Phoned at 7am today. Told I would get a call back within 6 hours. 7 hours had passed, phoned again as symptoms getting worse, again still waiting a call back 4 hours later. Should have gone to a&e at least I would have been treated by now.

title: Great new Hospital but....
body: Unfortunately, the only Cafe area did not provide de-caffinated hot drinks which is unfortunate for anyone with heart problems

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: No duty of care
body: Rang this hospital at 12:30 ( I never ever ring as I always think an appointment could go to a child) anyways rang them back at 3 as still hadn’t had a call back. To then wait 50 minutes to speek to some one to say the doctor knows your condition is worse yet still no phone call. Rang then again to be fobbed off  It’s now 7:44 no phone call at all there’s no duty of care at all

title: Great practice
body: Throughout the staff were methodical and swift, treatment was sure and positive . Thanks to all the staff involved at Spa Medica for the removal of the cataract would recommend with out hesitation .David Griffiths

title: Forward Looking
body:
My medical condition has fluctuated with circumstances including the impact of the Lockdown period during the Covid Pandemic and other social and medical situations.
Due to scheduled assessment periods, I was able to regularly discuss changes in my condition and for the practitioners to explore option treatments. New trials were open to reviews which gave me the opportunity to give feedback and so on.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Phones unanswered
body:
Rang to get an appointment at 8 am, was on hold for 2 hours, finally got to the end of the queue and was cut off. Rang back, waited an hour on hold, finally got my call answered and was given an appointment. A few days later someone from the surgery rang back and left me an answer phone message to cancel my appointment and asked me to ring the surgery back to book another!  
As if the cost of the phone calls wasn't enough in the first place I then ended up taking unpaid time off work and doing an hour round trip to visit the practice only to be told I could only get one if I rang in at 8 am the next day. I was then asked (in the very quiet waiting room) if I could tell them know exactly what the problem was and why I needed an appointment, this was in front of 3 people waiting (one of which had already contributed to my conversation about the wait as they had had a similar experience so they could obviously hear what I was saying). As this was very personal information I was not happy to provide this and politely declined. Eventually, I managed to persuade someone to allocate me an appointment and I was sent an appointment text message at 8 am the next day with a time of 14:55 for that day. Unfortunately, I had been up all night with a stomach bug so I was unable to attend so I tried to call the surgery again to cancel. I held for another hour on the phone and then gave up - my husband also tried for me later too and he waited for an hour on the phone and, like me, gave up too. We then found a form on the Larksfield website which I filled in to cancel instead. It was a good few hours before the appointment so plenty of notice given to allocate this appointment to someone else. I then received a text to say that I hadn't attended my appointment. Presumably, this will go on my notes and look bad when I rebook, if I ever manage to get another appointment, that is! :-(    
Very odd that there are relatively few people waiting in the waiting room and no phones can be heard ringing in the background. It is almost too quiet there now, personal information can easily be overheard and is not confidential at all. 
During lockdown the service provided by the practice was fantastic - there was an econsult process in place. Please Larksfield, if you are not going to answer the phone then please, please bring this service back!

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: It is now near impossible to get an appointment, the practice has too many patients, they can't handle any more, last call I rang at 08:36 to be 45th in the Que, 1.2 hours later told all appointments have gone, go to A+e, that's why the hospitals can't cope either, catch 22. They also will not give you routine appointments in advance, you have to ring at 08:30 so basically go away if you work shifts.. After 30+ years of being at this surgery I'm going to have to move surgeries it seems, they can't handle the volume of patients they have.. This is a real shame, it used to be great..

author: wezengf84
title: I am very pleased
body:
I am very pleased with the treatment that I have received at the Ulcer Clinic. The nurses are very professional but kind, considerate and helpful. At last, my leg ulcer is healing, after having had six months of treatment at a practice surgery. At that surgery, I feel that my ulcer was not healing.  
Just by chance, by having an appointment with another nurse, who happened to mention that there was an ulcer clinic, I was referred here. I wish that I had started coming here months earlier. I feel that my ulcer would have been healed by now.  
By putting up with months of attending a general practice clinic three times a week, having sometimes very painful dressings, I feel that this has contributed to my high levels of anxiety, for which I am now having treatment.

author: Super
title: Timing
body:
Every time I come for my diabetes appointments, I have to wait over 20minutes.  
This service cannot manage their appointments in my opinion, yet they seem to expect patients to rebook if they are late for an appointment.

readBy.name: City & Hackney GP Confederation
Rosewood Practice
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Brilliant caring doctors.
body: The doctors have been very helpful with a complex problem. They have put in a lot of work behind the scenes liaising with various hospitals medics.

title: Fantastic care and support at plastic’s clinic
body: Plastics clinic - Sisters H and all the staff on the plastics clinic go above and beyond with the care and support. You are a lovely team just to say thank you so much for everything.

title: Fantastic service
body: I was seen as an emergency appointment by a fantastic Dr who was kind, empathetic and called back with results way after home time. Thank you for everything.

title: Thank you
body: The paramedics were promptly on the scene. They were kind and caring and they stayed with my wife and supported me until she died.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Doctors are great
body: Can’t get an appointment for love or money, but when they contact you, your appointment is within a few days and the doctors are brilliant. I saw Dr McGrath and he was terrific.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Living with a serious, complex, long term health condition is challenging, not just for me but also those involved in my care. When you have a wonderful, extremely competent  team looking after you it’s very reassuring and helps to make a rather difficult life easier.  I want to thank everyone at Studholme for always going above and beyond with my care. Their interaction and communication is great and their knowledge and expertise is outstanding. The practice website is very easy to navigate and use, the response time for booking appointment or asking them a question is quick and I love the text message service. I would highly recommend anyone thinking of joining this practice to do so. I really do appreciate all your hard work and support, I would most certainly be lost without you all. Huge, massive thank you :)

title: A great practice but run off their feet!
body:
My wife who has Multiple Sclerosis was having symptoms which did not seem related, within two weeks she had a blood test, two weeks later a scan. The diagnosis was made, medication was provided all other things were eliminated thank goodness. The pharmacy are always helpful and I can’t thank them enough for the work they do, they always seem to be run off their feet. 
I can’t understand all the negativity you read on Neighbourhood web sites. I honestly believe if treat people (no matter who they are) the same way you would want to be treated then you can’t go wrong. I know it’s a pain having to wait in a call queue so if it’s a long one put the phone.  down and try a bit later, people seem to want everything now, they just can’t wait. If it’s urgent or serious then ring 111, take a ride to A&E or dial 999 I  review as I fine and I find them to be excellent.

title: Impressive Service
body:
Really impressed with the speed and helpfulness of the staff in A & E. I attended with my girlfriend who had a suspected broken arm. She was seen by triage within an hour, then sent to X-ray where she was xrayed and sent back to A & E within 25 mins. On return to A & E she was told her arm was broken and was put into a cast, again within the hour.

I wasn’t looking forward to going into A & E but was pleasantly surprised by their efficiency and politeness. 

Thank you to all the staff at Queens

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Personal ?
body: Sat near reception I was astounded to see a member of staff push in front of the queue and knock an elderly man 2 steps to the side. Having waited 1hour 15 mins over the appointment time I asked at reception only to have the above member of staff very put out at having to explain , that was made very obvious. Belligerent and unhelpful ! I found this really sad that one person clouded the experience at the clinic . The rest of the staff were pleasant , polite and very helpful.

readBy.name: East Lancashire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Absolute angels and I cannot be more grateful
body:
I was booked in for induction 15/11 as I was nearly 2 weeks overdue. They were super prompt in finding me a bed in marsh ward. The midwives were lovely and got the induction process moving quickly. They discussed my options and I opted for the balloon . This has to remain for 24 hours before next assessment. I was given the option to go home for this time, or to stay in hospital. I chose to stay in hospital in case anything happened (I.e balloon coming out)  My partner was allowed to stay while I was there which was lovely. 
When I was ready for delivery, I was taken to the delivery suite where 2 (again lovely) midwives stayed with me the whole 9 hour labor, they monitored me and baby constantly and kept me informed as there were several potential complications they were keeping a close eye on. My natural birth turned into an emergency c-section due to further complications and the whole team were just amazingly quick to act and to deliver my baby as safely as possible. They kept me informed of everything happening. 
I was rushed into theatre within minutes of the decision being made where the surgical team were waiting and didn’t waste a single minute. My baby girl was safely delivered and I was sutured up within 20 minutes of entering. Absolutely incredible surgical team. 
I was then taken to iffley ward where I stayed for a further 2 nights. The midwives were incredible. There was one midwife in particular( I called her my angel )  who really looked after me, from helping me clean myself up changing my padded underwear. To realising I was shattered and taking my daughter away for a couple of hours to feed and look after so I could get some sleep. And just being super chatty and friendly.
My blood pressure etc was monitored regularly to make sure I was ok. 
My daughter was monitored closely too.
They came to every alarm call, yes, you could be waiting a few minutes at a time, but these nurses were absolutely rushed off their feet . They were all working so hard. 
The care I received from all the staff in all the departments of maternity was outstanding and although my birth plan didn’t go according to plan, they all played their part in making me feel safe, secure and making the experience as stress free as possible. I cannot thank the team enough. 
We really need to protect our nhs workers. They have an extremely demanding job, and just work their butts off . Thank you again to everyone involved who delivered my baby girl and looked after me. You’re all hero’s in my eyes x

readBy.name: Royal Berkshire NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing care
body:
This year I had two emergency admissions to Ealing Hospital - I spent nearly a week in AMU in March and was admitted again in October with a different illness this time to Ward 3 South for 5 days.
The care that I received during both stays was amazing - from doctors, nurses, radiology staff, health care assistants and everyone I came into contact with. The staff on both wards were so caring and patient and the medical treatment I received was excellent.
I feel lucky to have such a great hospital so close to my home. 
The doctors in A&E were very skilled at diagnosing me and getting me the care that I needed - it is a shame that A&E is so understaffed - it is an incredibly busy department and I feel sorry for the staff who have to deal with frustrated patients. 
But I will always choose Ealing Hospital if I am unfortunate enough to need emergency care again - I think it is a great hospital.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Amazing staff
body: Being a first time mum I had no idea what to expect with labour. I felt like I had quite a traumatic birth with an unplanned c section but the whole time I was supported and well cared for. The midwives and doctors were just absolutely incredible and because of them I would feel safe to go through the whole experience again. They made me feel so comfortable and relaxed the whole time. Thank you!

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely reception team
body: I have had a few really good experiences with the reception team. They have given a really personal service that has made a big difference to my care.

title: Highly recommend- Saved my life
body: No words could explain the incredible quality of care I received at Royal Free. Having been admitted for emergency surgery, my end to end experience was extraordinary. I am forever grateful and would recommend the hospital to anyone in need or emergency care.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Impossible to get through
body: It is impossible for elderly people suffering from dementia to get through the telephone system. I have tried on behalf of an elderly relative to talk to Reception/Nurses/Drs and it takes a minimum of 30 minutes. Old people find this very frustrating. On one occasion I was number 40! in the queue just after 0800. It seems to me that this surgery has too many patients than they can handle and people are not getting the care and attention they deserve. All the running is being done by patients trying to navigate the telephone system when it is healthcare professionals that need to be proactively following up on treatment outcomes.

title: Amazing care
body: All the nurses and HCA’s I spoke to were absolutely lovely, really caring, kind and chatty which helps put you at ease. The doctor who saw me was very thorough and explained everything they were doing which made a difference. They double checked the information I gave them was correct and even though the department was really busy, I didn’t feel like I was just being rushed through. I felt in safe hands throughout and nothing was too much for them. Thank you.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Helpfull
body: The staff are so kind and welcoming when you first arrive so clean bright lots of light coming through and clear signs on where to go so so so easy all sign posted

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly and approachable sugical staff
body: Their careful assessment and confident manner was very reassuring  and I would not hesitate to undergo the procedure again

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad food machines and restaurant
body: choice is really really sad, what foolish person decides what content, chocolate nuts etc etc etc, you ever heard of different food, something fresh I searched all floors try find something decent, me not a happy chappy, alas I know complaint will do nothing, but I complained. restaurant, hint what fool ,has it closed when possible busy perio starts, afternoons, breakfast yes, very important, but come on folks people visit in afternoons an patients like to wander with family to that sort stuff, and dare I say a lot more in afternoons surely it's worth a 3 month trial just so you get the lazy person off there bottoms when they decide close at 2 lol. Sorry, rant is over now time for update next year, lol

title: The best practice.
body: No matter who you deal with, from the practice manager, all the doctors, nurses and support staff everyone is so nice, caring and truly supportive! I couldn’t rate the entire practice ethos more highly.

readBy.name: Harvey Group Practice

title: Great doctors, tho you never see the same one…
body: Brilliant, attentive, compassionate, if you can actually get an appointment, honestly the doctors are mostly patient and understanding, one or 2 seem to want you out of the door asap but most will listen and help, it's not always the result you want but at least they are honest, and tbh they are over stretched and it's a ghost town for staff so I assume under funded too, but they do their best, tho that call by 8:30 for a same day appointment thing needs to go, because everyone calls at once and by the time you get through, it's oh sorry please try again tomorrow.

title: Unacceptable A&E Wait Time
body: Arrived at 09:45am on a Sunday morning with my 18month old who had a high temp & head to toe rash. Was advised the wait may be up to 14 hours (and some had been waiting that long!) and that only one parent could stay as they were so busy, which was very distressing for my child. After 3 hours one of the consultants came out to the waiting room shouting that parents needed to stop asking reception and the initial assessment nursing staff how much longer they would be waiting. I think this needs to be addressed and the staff need to be mindful that these are very worried parents with seriously unwell children who are being made to wait fourteen hours, and maybe adjust attitudes / patient care a little. In total we waited 6 hours to be told my child had a viral rash, only to take her to the gp the following day to find out she actually had Scarlet Fever / Strep a. Absolutely appalling from start to finish.

readBy.name: Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body:
Absolutely excellent care received from the team. 

Delt with quickly and efficiently. Very caring and thorough nurses in what is a very busy and demanding period. 

Extremely grateful.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care and support
body: During the past 12 months I have received the very best care from the team of physiotherapists in St Richards Munro Unit. After I fractured my patella I thought I would be unable to walk easily, pain free again. Thanks to the encouragement excellent help and advice I have received from the physiotherapists I am well on the way to full recovery. I will never be able to thank everyone enough, the Exercise Gym sessions in the Munro Unit have been invaluable. I wish to thank the friendly helpful receptionists in the Munro Unit and all the doctors nurses and staff in St Richards who have helped me so much.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: I had a recurrent ear infection that started on Christmas Eve 2021 and reoccurred for the next few months . All the team at Willow bank form the receptionists ,advanced nurse practitioner and Doctors were efficient , professional and caring. You are doing a great job in very trying circumstances .. thank you

title: Outstanding
body: I was admitted for emergency surgery for a perforated appendicitis. After surgery my codition deteriorated and I was admitted to icu.  The team of doctors and nurses in icu were amazing and the attention and care I received was simply outstanding.   Even when on a ward, in my case 6a and 7a the staff were brilliant, so caring, attentive and professional.   Without doubt my experience from start to finish was of the highest standard.

title: Very poor service
body:
I am appalled at the level of patient service ( or rather lack thereof ) which I experienced on Monday 5th. December last.   After a ridiculous amount of time wasted in a telephone queue ( in excess of 30 waiters ), I chose to visit the surgery in my efforts to try and obtain an appointment.  After waiting in another line for more than 20 minutes, I finally got to speak to your receptionist, explaining that my visit was a last resort effort to speak to somebody.  I need a face-to-face appointment, as my medical predicament is not appropriate for a telephone consultation, but also, I am profoundly deaf, so such an appointment is clearly not suitable for me.   Your receptionist told me that there were no 'walk-in' appointments available for that day, and I would need to phone in, or visit at 08.00 hrs. to have a greater chance of sustaining such an appointment; - I explained that I had found this process unfruitful.  
 I was then told that there were no appointment slots available - with any doctor before Christmas - let alone my own, -  so I asked for one after the Xmas period.  Again, I was told that no appointment could be made for me at this time.  I took the only subsequent advice afforded me, and phoned the 111 emergency service, which I am pleased to say, did find me a time slot, that day, at another practice in Whitstable, where a Nurse Practitioner examined me physically, and prescribed medication. The Nurse told me that I should make an appointment with my own doctor within the next week, for "A Review" of my condition.  When I mentioned that I had found this difficult, I was told that I need to be assertive, and insist on seeing my Doctor personally.   Now, from my experiences detailed above, I very much doubt that this is going to prove possible, so perhaps you can understand my predicament here, and thus I must ask you for your advice and guidance on a suitable way forward for me. 
I trust you will agree that I have not been afforded a very good service on this occasion.

title: Very welcoming and all staff very friendly.
body: From the reception to the discharge nurse all the staff were full of smiles and explained everything.

title: Excellent care
body:
From first seeing the Consultant, to having the operation to the follow up care, the care I have received has been excellent.
I am a nurse myself and have high standards and expectations. The nursing care was exceptional. Very attentive, thoughtful and kind. 
I was very nervous and all the staff made me feel more at ease and explained everything well.
 My room was very clean and comfortable, and the food good.
My scars are amazing, can hardly see them.
The phone call I had when I had been at home for a day was a nice touch.

title: Professional Service
body: Both pre-op assessment and cataract surgery carried out with professional care and courtesy. After initial eye drops, surgery was quick, 10 minutes, with no discomfort and hardly any sensation. In and out under 2 hours.

title: Great service
body: Very efficient & friendly staff, well organised. Process for 2nd cataract surgery was much quicker than 1st, obviously due to less information being required 2nd time.

title: Waste of time and taxi fare
body: Arrived on a Saturday with my wife who had fallen and broken her arm. Place was deserted and a grumpy receptionist told us to wait to see a nurse. The nurse then told us their x-ray machine wasn’t working and she didn’t have morphine so couldn’t manipulate the arm - so she sent us to A&E at Frimley. We wasted £50 on a taxi there and back. What kind of “ Urgent Care” place is this??  It feels like they are not interested and just want to pass the buck onto another part of the NHS.

title: Very Friendly and extremely helpful
body: Had scan at MRI mobile in Oncolgy carpark. Very friendly staff, extremely helpful and caring. Made you feel at ease.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Poor Practice
body: After using this surgery for around 30 years I'm sorry to say that this Surgery in my opinion is not fit for purpose. You can never get an appointment with a GP and struggle constantly to get through on the telephone. When i have been offered a telephone appointment it has never been with a GP. It has always been a practice nurse or equivalent. I've constantly been given the wrong advice by the reception staff and repeat prescriptions take over a week to process even though on the website they asks for 48 working hours notice.

title: Wonderful Care
body:
Rang in the morning explaining how poorly I felt, had an in person appointment 2 hours later.
As usual treated with dignity, kindness and compassion. Nothing was too much, advice given was reassuring.
Prescription dealt with without problems too.

title: Disappointed
body: Been on the phone over an hour for the second time, my son has a fever and other symptoms going on 5 days now and not going down, wanted to get an advice and probably antibiotics to help with the infection, instead of going to A&E where there will be so many others people and horrendous wait time (by what he could get worse). In the end will have to go down to A&E to get help, what’s to point of 111 as they are unable to even pick up the phone/call back and help when is needed to?

title: Disgusting
body: Have phoned 3 times today. 2 x 55min calls cut off by 111. Further call waited for 1hr 44mins and then cut off. No wonder a&e depth are under such pressure.

title: Very helpful practice
body:
First of all staff is very friendly 
Whatever or whenever  I ask something, They reply Kindly with big smile. That makes me so happy and comfortable Doctors are also friendly and very helpful.

title: Waiting
body: Filled in online nhs form and was advised to ring 111 and mention that I had to be seen within 6 hours.  I was told a nurse will ring me back. Still waiting and it’s been 8 hours. Rang back with worse symptoms but it took over an hour to get through. Still no call back

title: Excellent appointment with my gp
body: My gp was very helpful at my appointment on Saturday morning. She has been very supportive to me. Being able to make an appointment on a Saturday morning is also very useful.

title: All round caring team
body: I rang the GP to get a face to face appointment for my 18 year old daughter. The receptionist I spoke to was patient, empathetic, kind and really listened to me.  She took the time to quickly solve the problem of patient consent, requesting a hand written letter from my daughter giving the GP consent to speak to me on her behalf. A GP contacted me within 3 hours and after listening carefully, and compassionately to what I had to say, booked a face to face appointment for the following day with one of her colleagues. The GP my daughter saw took a real interest in her concerns and after consulting with her about the next course of action has hopefully started the ball rolling on the best treatment for her going forward. My only issue, and hence not 5 stars, is that it took for me to get involved for her to have a face to face appointment, despite having tried herself on numerous occasions. In this instance though I could not fault the service we experienced, everyone I spoke to at the practice understood my frustrations and showed nothing but kindness, patience and sympathy.
